problem: South is in 3NT. After cashing the diamonds and hearts, East is squeezed in spades and hearts. How should declarer plan the play?
explanation: Leading ♦A is correct to establish tricks quickly.

problem: South is in 6♥. After drawing trumps, declarer has a number of side-suit winners but East guards both spades and diamonds. How should declarer play the side suits to effect the simple squeeze and make the contract?
options: Cash all side-suit winners in the right order to squeeze East
Lead a spade immediately to set up a spade trick
Give up a trick in diamonds first to establish entries
Play off clubs first then stop
answer: Cash all side-suit winners in the right order to squeeze East
explanation: Draw trumps, then run the established winners (e.g. clubs and high side winners) so East is forced to unguard either spades or diamonds. That creates an extra trick for declarer.

title: Declarer Play
problem: West leads ♥4. What is South's best plan?
explanation: Ducking preserves a stopper and keeps control against East's hearts.
